text: this is mike shear with the new york
times and we're here at the entrance to
the straw poll in ames iowa and I
thought I would do a little walking tour
so you guys can get a sense of the kinds
of things that are here so i'll switch
the camera and here we go one of the
things that you'll see is a lot of buses
there's the voter values bus throughout
the area there's lots of foods that
people have paid to rent so you have the
citizens united over there and of course
a lot of media each of the candidates
pay to reserve space at the straw poll
which is in essence a fundraiser for the
republican party for the state repeal i
would state republican party so the more
the candidates spend the bigger and
better space they get theirs ron paul's
tent one of the better spaces right in
the center
some of the campaign's bring out things
for kids because they want the families
the parents to come so you have the
sliding dollar from ron paul for the
kids as we head this way back towards
the coliseum you can see one of the
biggest associations hence here for the
AARP you also have some character actors
there's Teddy Roosevelt I believe
as we head down towards the other
candidates there's Mike Huckabee has a
tent even though he's not in the straw
poll this year lots of folks using the
opportunity to sign folks up for other
things Stephen King local congressman
got his signs out
as we passed down this way here's the
NRA they've got they're handing out free
bright orange hats if you join the nra
looks like they're actually maybe
passing them out even if you don't join
the nra
heading down the this part of the
boulevard will end up at the Bachmann
tent Michele Bachmann has one of the
bigger setups here she's got a big
closed in air conditioned tent that
usually helps on the the straw after
straw poll because it's often very very
hot behind here you've you've got the
other biggest Association here is the
American Wind Power Association that's
one of the blades from one of their

though he set up a little bouncy for the
kids and he's got a van not exactly
professional but does the job and then
we we head back this way to the Rick
Santorum tent mr. Santorum's got got
lines for folks that are checking in
they've got burgers that they're making
for their for their supporters
and music that's a big thing here to all
of the campaign's bring in a variety of
different kinds of music to entertain
their their supporters although demand
right there is the currently put on by
the tea party patriots here's the line
to get in the Coliseum for the speeches
and the light and the voting I guess
this is actually the line for the voting
it's probably a good sign for the
Republican Party for the state
Republican Party that the line so long
remember as I said this is a fundraiser
and so the more people that are here the
more money the party raises for its
efforts over the course of the next year
the lot of these people haven't paid
themselves the campaign's in order to
get them here will pay the thirty
dollars that it costs and that way the
folks can come for free and the state
party still gets their their cash
there's a couple of candidates that
aren't here that don't have any presence
here of course Mitt Romney and Jon
Huntsman have decided not to participate
in the straw poll and Sarah Palin who
was in Iowa yesterday and spent much of
the day at the State Fair is also not an
announced candidate so you don't see any
presence for any of those folks at the
straw poll the end of our tour here
though is is the last the last big
effort which is that of tim pawlenty
kind of off to the side here but one of
the bigger tents pawlenty has a has a
big band stand a real large tent
a lot of supporters he's a featuring
famous daves BBQ and blizzards from
Dairy Queen in the hopes of getting
folks here so that in a few minutes is
essentially walking tour of the Iowa
straw poll not that big but an important
moment for the for the Republican Party
and the Republican presidential
nomination
